sen.j: 大蔵卿局（おおくらきょうのつぼね、？ - 慶長20年5月8日 (旧暦)（1615年6月4日））は戦国時代 (日本)～江戸時代の女性。
sen.e: Okurakyo-no-tsubone (? - June 4, 1615) was a woman in the Sengoku Period (Japan) - the Edo Period.
Okurakyo-no-tsubone (? - June 4, 1615) was a woman in the Sengoku Period (Japan) - the Edo Period.
Okurakyo-no-tsubone (? - June 4, 1615) was a woman in the Sengoku period (period of warring states) - the Edo Period.
sen.cmt: 戦国時代の定訳「数字不一致確認済み」

sen.e: Okura-no-tsubone
Okura-no-tsubone
Okura-no-tsubone
Kosode
Kosode
Kosode

sen.j: 丹後国の地侍・大野佐渡守の妻。
sen.e: She was a wife of Satomori ONO, jizamurai (local samurai) in Tango Province.
She was a wife of Satomori ONO, jizamurai (local samurai) in Tango Province.
She was a wife of Satomori ONO, jizamurai (local samurai) in Tango Province.

sen.j: 子に大野治長・大野治房・大野治胤。
sen.e: Harunaga ONO, Harufusa ONO and Harutane ONO were her sons.
Harunaga ONO, Harufusa ONO and Harutane ONO were her sons.
Harunaga ONO, Harufusa ONO and Harutane ONO were her sons.

sen.j: 淀殿や豊臣秀頼の乳母を務めている。
sen.e: She served Yodo-dono and Hideyori TOYOTOMI as menoto (a woman providing breast-feed to a highborn baby).
She served Yodo-dono and Hideyori TOYOTOMI as menoto (a wetnurse for babies of royal birth).
She served Yodo-dono and Hideyori TOYOTOMI as menoto (a woman providing breast-feed to a highborn baby).

sen.j: 秀吉の正室である高台院とその従者の孝蔵主が去った後、子の大野三兄弟と共に豊臣家で権勢を振るった。
sen.e: She wielded power inside the Toyotomi family along with Ono three brothers, her sons, after Kodaiin, Hideyoshi' lawful wife, and Kozosu, Kodaiin's attendant, passed away.
She wielded power inside the Toyotomi family along with Ono three brothers, her sons, after Kodaiin, Hideyoshi' lawful wife, and Kozosu, Kodaiin's attendant, passed away.
She wielded power inside the Toyotomi family along with Ono three brothers, her sons, after Kodaiin, Hideyoshi' lawful wife, and Kozosu, Kodaiin's attendant, passed away.
sen.cmt: 「数字不一致確認済み」Ono の前のスペース短縮

tit.e: The incident of Hoko-ji Temple bell
The incident of Hoko-ji Temple bell
The incident of Hoko-ji Temple bell

sen.j: 慶長19年（1614年）に起こった方広寺鐘銘事件では駿府の大御所徳川家康の元まで赴く。
sen.e: When the incident of Hoko-ji Temple bell occurred in 1614, she went to Sunpu to see Ogosho Ieyasu TOKUGAWA.
When the incident of Hoko-ji Temple bell occurred in 1614, she went to Sunpu to see Ogosho Ieyasu TOKUGAWA.
When the incident of Hoko-ji Temple bell occurred in 1614, she went to Sunpu to see Ogosho (leading or influential figure) Ieyasu TOKUGAWA.
sen.cmt: 「数字不一致確認済み」大御所の説明追記

sen.j: ここで家康は離間の計を仕掛ける。
sen.e: In this meeting, Ieyasu hatched a plot to induce the split among the people of Toyotomi family.
In this meeting, Ieyasu hatched a plot to induce a split among the people of the Toyotomi family.
In this meeting, Ieyasu hatched a plot to induce a split among the people of the Toyotomi family.

sen.j: 大蔵卿局に対し、家康は殊勝な態度で甘い要求を出した。
sen.e: On one hand, Ieyasu proposed, with a humble attitude, generous demand to Okurakyo-no-tsubone.
On one hand, Ieyasu proposed, humbly, a generous demand towards Okurakyo-no-tsubone.
On one hand, Ieyasu proposed, humbly, a generous demand towards Okurakyo-no-tsubone.

sen.j: しかし、別行動で家康のもとへ豊臣家救済を訴えかけていた穏健派の片桐且元に対しては、家康は厳しい要求ばかりを突きつけた。
sen.e: On the other hand, Ieyasu pressed severe demand on Katsumoto KATAGIRI, who represented the moderates and had been separately asking Ieyasu to save the Toyotomi family.
On the other hand, Ieyasu made severe demands on Katsumoto KATAGIRI, who represented the moderates and had been separately asking Ieyasu to save the Toyotomi family.
On the other hand, Ieyasu made severe demands on Katsumoto KATAGIRI, who represented the moderates and had been separately asking Ieyasu to save the Toyotomi family.

sen.j: 当然、大蔵卿局と且元の意見は食い違い、かみ合わない。
sen.e: Naturally, the opinions of Okurakyo-no-tsubone and Katsumoto differed and didn't dovetail.
Naturally, the opinions of Okurakyo-no-tsubone and Katsumoto differed and didn't dovetail.
Naturally, the opinions of Okurakyo-no-tsubone and Katsumoto differed and didn't dovetail.

sen.j: 大坂城の強硬派は且元を徳川の間者だと思い込むようになり、淀殿の説得にも関わらず且元は大坂城から退去せざるを得なかった。
sen.e: Hawkish people at Osaka Castle came to believe that Katsumoto was a spy of Tokugawa and eventually, Katsumoto was forced to leave Osaka Castle despite the persuasion by Yodo-dono.
Watchful people at Osaka Castle came to believe that Katsumoto was a spy of Tokugawa and eventually, Katsumoto was forced to leave Osaka Castle despite the persuasion by Yodo-dono.
Watchful people at Osaka Castle came to believe that Katsumoto was a spy of Tokugawa and eventually, Katsumoto was forced to leave Osaka Castle despite the persuasion by Yodo-dono.

sen.j: その様子を見た他の穏健派の武将達も豊臣家の行く末を見限りまとめて大坂城から出て行った。
sen.e: Other moderate busho (Japanese military commander) who watched the scene also gave up the future of the Toyotomi family and left Osaka Castle.
Other moderate busho (Japanese military commander) who watched the scene also gave up on the future of the Toyotomi family and left Osaka Castle.
Other moderate busho (Japanese military commander) who watched the scene also gave up on the future of the Toyotomi family and left Osaka Castle.

sen.j: 結局豊臣家はこの事件からわずか1年後に滅びることになる。
sen.e: After this incident, the Toyotomi family became extinct only one year later.
After this incident, the Toyotomi family became extinct only one year later.
After this incident, the Toyotomi family became extinct only one year later.

sen.j: 追いつめられ自害した秀頼や淀殿に殉じる形で、息子の治長と共に大蔵卿局も自害を遂げている。
sen.e: After Hideyori and Yodo-dono were brought to bay and committed suicide, Okurakyo-no-tsubone followed them to the grave along with her son Harunaga.
After Hideyori and Yodo-dono were brought to bay and committed suicide, Okurakyo-no-tsubone followed them to the grave along with her son Harunaga.
After Hideyori and Yodo-dono were brought to bay and committed suicide, Okurakyo-no-tsubone followed them to the grave along with her son Harunaga.
